meanings.sent1: The bells clangoring in the distance woke me up.
meanings.sent2: The construction site was clangoring with the sound of hammers and drills.
meanings.sent3: The clangoring of pots and pans in the kitchen made it seem like a musical performance.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter clangored through the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm outside was clangoring so loudly that it felt like the sky was shouting.

meanings.definition: A loud, resonant sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The clangoring of the fire alarm made everyone evacuate the building.
meanings.sent2: The clangoring of the church bells could be heard throughout the town.
meanings.sent3: The clangoring of the wind chimes in the garden created a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The clangoring of the metal gate closing echoed in the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The clangoring of the gong signaled the start of the ceremony.
